raw_text:
Holmes wins '2004 top TV moment'
 
 Sprinter Kelly Holmes' Olympic victory has been named the top television moment of 2004 in a BBC poll.
 
 Holmes' 800m gold medal victory beat favourite moments from drama, comedy and factual programmes, as voted by television viewers. Natasha Kaplinsky's Strictly Come Dancing win was top entertainment moment and a Little Britain breast feeding sketch won the comedy prize. The 2004 TV Moments will be shown on BBC One at 2000 GMT on Wednesday. Double gold medal winner Holmes topped the best sports moment category, beating Maria Sharapova's Wimbledon triumph and Matthew Pinsent's rowing victory at the Olympics.
 
 She then went on to take the overall prize of Golden TV Moment. The sight of former royal correspondent Jennie Bond with dozens of rats crawling over her in ITV's I'm a Celebrity Get Me Out of Here was named best factual entertainment moment. Michael Buerk's return to Ethiopia, 20 years after originally reporting its famine, topped the factual category for BBC programme This World. Long-running soap EastEnders won the best popular drama moment title when character Dot confided in Den Watts that she was unwell.
llama3.2:1b: Kelly Holmes wins "2004 top TV moment" with gold medal victory at Olympics. Natasha Kaplinsky's Strictly Come Dancing win and Little Britain breast feeding sketch take second and third places respectively.
llama3.2:3b: Kelly Holmes' Olympic victory was named the top TV moment of 2004 by a BBC poll, beating other favourite moments from various programmes. The 2004 TV Moments will air on BBC One.
gemma2:2b: Kelly Holmes won the top TV moment award in a BBC poll for her Olympic 800m gold medal victory.  Natasha Kaplinsky's Strictly Come Dancing win was ranked as top entertainment, while Little Britain's breast feeding sketch took the comedy prize.  Holmes also won the overall Golden TV Moment award.   Jennie Bond's "I'm a Celebrity" segment with rats was named best factual entertainment moment. Michael Buerk's Ethiopia reporting and EastEnders drama winning 'best popular drama moment'.
qwen2.5:0.5b: Holmes' Olympic gold medal victory was named the top TV moment of 2004 by a BBC poll, beating other notable moments from sports, entertainment and factual programming. She then took the overall Golden TV Moment at I'm a Celebrity Get Me Out of Here, while Jennie Bond's rat sighting in ITV's I'm a Celebrity Get Me Out of Here topped the factual category for BBC programmes. The Golden TV Moment was voted the best television moment of 2004 by a BBC poll and she took it from a BBC poll winner, with her Olympic gold medal victory beating Natasha Kaplinsky's Strictly Come Dancing win as top entertainment moment and Little Britain breast-feeding sketch winning the comedy prize.
qwen2.5:1.5b: Kelly Holmes wins "2004 Top TV Moment" poll; hailed as fastest woman to win Olympic gold, beating Maria Sharapova's Wimbledon victory and Matthew Pinsent's rowing triumph at the Olympics.
qwen2.5:3b: Holmes' 800m gold medal victory at the 2004 Olympics was named the top TV moment by viewers, beating other notable moments from Strictly Come Dancing, Little Britain, Maria Sharapova's Wimbledon win, Matthew Pinsent's rowing victory, and Michael Buerk's Ethiopia famine story. Holmes also won the best sports moment prize. ITV’s I'm a Celebrity...Get Me Out of Here for Bond’s rat encounter was named best factual entertainment moment. EastEnders’ Dot’s health confession to Den Watts took the best popular drama moment title.

smollm:1.7b:
The summary should be concise and focus on the key ideas:

1. Holmes wins '2004 top TV moment' - The text mentions Holmes' Olympic victory as a notable achievement, but does not provide further details about it.
2. Sprinter Kelly Holmes' Olympic victory has been named the top television moment of 2004 in a BBC poll - This sentence provides more information about Holmes' achievement, stating that it was nominated by viewers for being the best TV moment of 2004.
3. Holmes' 800m gold medal victory beat favourite moments from drama, comedy and factual programmes - The text mentions that Holmes' achievement was not only notable but also compared to other popular sports events.
4. Natasha Kaplinsky's Strictly Come Dancing win was top entertainment moment and a Best British Comedy Moment - This sentence provides more information about the achievement of Natasha Kaplinsky, stating that it was one of the best comedy moments of 2004.
5. The 2004 TV Moments will be shown on BBC One at 2000 GMT on Wednesday - The text mentions that the 2004 TV Moments will be broadcast live on BBC One at 2000 GMT on Wednesday, providing more details about the timing of the event.
6. Double gold medal winner Holmes tops the best sports moment category - This sentence provides more information about Holmes' achievement, stating that it was the highest-scoring achievement in the Olympics.
7. She then went on to take the overall prize of Golden TV Moment - The text mentions that Holmes' achievement was not only notable but also compared to other popular sports events and achieved a gold medal as well.
8. Michael Buerk's return to Ethiopia, 20 years after originally reporting its famine, tops the factual category for BBC programme This World - This sentence provides more information about Michael Buerk's achievement, stating that it was one of the most notable achievements in the history of BBC News.
deepseek-r1:1.5b:
<think>
Alright, so I need to summarize this text. Let me read through it carefully.

The first sentence is about Holmes winning a TV moment poll in 2004, specifically an Olympic victory over other categories. Then the second part mentions details about some specific events like Natasha Kaplinsky's win and other competition entries. The third part gives the schedule for BBC One. There's also mention of a show on ITV called I'm a Celebrity Get Me Out of Here featuring Jennie Bond with rats, which was a factual moment.

So, my task is to condense all these points into a single summary. I should keep the key ideas: Holmes winning, specific events, schedule, and some notable shows. I'll make sure not to include explanations or formatting beyond the plain text as instructed.
</think>

Holmes wins 2004 Olympic moment poll with victory over competitors in sports, drama, and factual TV categories.
tinyllama:1.1b:
Holmes wins 'top TV moment' of 2004 with victory in 800m track, beating comedy and drama moments

Sprinter Kelly Holmes' 19th Olympic gold medal win overtakes the favourite drama, comedy, and factual entertainment moments as BBC voters name their top TV moment of the year. Natasha Kaplinsky's Strictly Come Dancing win was runner-up in the entertainment category. The 2004 TV Moments will be broadcast on BBC One at 2000 GMT on Wednesday, with Double Olympic gold medal winner Holmes winning the Golden TV Moment prize. Other notable moments include Jennie Bond's rodent encounter and character Doctor Watters confiding to Dotty that she was "unwell" in soap EastEnders.
tinydolphin:1.1b: The most popular TV moments of 2004 were awarded by a BBC poll, and according to the summary provided, Holmes won the 'top TV moment' with her Olympic victory in 800m race. Second place went to the Little Britain breastfeeding sketch, and the third spot was taken by an upset result of Natasha Kaplinsky's Strictly Come Dancing win. This poll will be aired on BBC One at 2000 GMT on Wednesday.
phi:2.7b:
Kelly Holmes' gold medal win at the 2004 Olympics beats competition from various genres of TV shows to become the top television moment of 2004. 

Holmes's 800m victory in Sydney beat out other memorable moments, including Maria Sharapova's Wimbledon triumph and Matthew Pinsent's rowing victory at the Olympics. In addition, the sight of former royal correspondent Jennie Bond with dozens of rats crawling over her on ITV's I'm a Celebrity Get Me Out of Here was named best factual entertainment moment. Michael Buerk' s return to Ethiopia 20 years after reporting its famine for the BBC topped the factual category for This World. Finally, long-running soap opera EastEnders became the best popular drama moment when character Dot confided in Den Watts that she was unwell.

reference: Holmes' 800m gold medal victory beat favourite moments from drama, comedy and factual programmes, as voted by television viewers.Sprinter Kelly Holmes' Olympic victory has been named the top television moment of 2004 in a BBC poll.Double gold medal winner Holmes topped the best sports moment category, beating Maria Sharapova's Wimbledon triumph and Matthew Pinsent's rowing victory at the Olympics.The sight of former royal correspondent Jennie Bond with dozens of rats crawling over her in ITV's I'm a Celebrity Get Me Out of Here was named best factual entertainment moment.
